page.title: 03 MACKEREL FISHING
page.content: On Wednesday 3rd.July 1985 part of Trinity School went mackerel fishing on the boat "Britannia",skippered by Jim Mattews.We started off at 0945 putting out into Teignmouth Bay where the water was about forty feet deep.We fished off Mackerel Cove which is the only place between Teignmouth and Babbacombe where a net can be cast from the shore without being fouled by the rocks.The tackel consisted of rods which had five or six hooks and were lead- weighted. Jim had been fishing all his life, as had also his father.There are not as many mackerel as formerly despite the multitude of plankton,which has caused an increase in their price. Jim's business slackens in the winter when he only reckons to take small groups of local anglers deep-sea fishing for fish such as conger eels.
